What You Will Do:
As a home health physical therapist, you will provide one on one treatment and care to patients in their home using a comprehensive and patient specific care plan, innovative solutions, and a preferred technology for point of care documentation. You will have the opportunity to spend quality time with the patient, in their own home, to promote their health and independence. You will have autonomy in addition to the support and collaboration of a full team of healthcare professionals.
Collaborate with physicians, patients and their families, nurses, therapists, social workers and other members of the patient care team to develop and implement a patient specific care and treatment plan
Cooperatively utilize varied solutions to educate and promote the health and independence of the patient

Job Title: Private Home Caregiver
Job Description:
Looking for care/assistance for a successful retirement age businessman. He started from scratch a cattle/farming operation that spans a multi-state area but has had some major setbacks in overall health. He does not want to slow down in everyday life and wants to continue being involved with the family business. He needs assistance with his daily tasks. The job site/home is just south of Overland Park, KS in town of Bucyrus, KS.
He is struggling with his oxygen levels upon exertion. He requires a walker to move around the house and needs assistance getting up out of a chair. He is very quick-witted with an ornery personality. He enjoys having fun with others. Caregiver must have some thick skin and be willing to handle some of his moments of being frustrated with his current condition.
You will be tasked with helping the patient with personal hygiene, minor medical needs, housekeeping, and other daily needs as required by the patient. To excel in this role, you should have an interest in health care as well as an interest in the patient's happiness/well-being. We are looking for a caring individual who has the ability to work with limited supervision while keeping the patient's needs as your top priority.

Job Title: Home Care Provider I
Job Description:
Are you looking for a way to aid your community in a time of need? Are you an experienced family or independent caregiver looking for training and career advancement opportunities? If yes, then apply now for the Home Care Provider I position with Homebridge.
Under the direction of a Care Supervisor and Manager of Care Teams, Home Care Providers (HCPs) provide in-home caregiving services to aging adults and people with disabilities in San Francisco with complex social and behavioral support needs. By supporting recipients with their activities of daily living in and around their homes, we are making independent living possible, keeping our hospitals and clinics clear. Care providers are essential to addressing our public health crisis.
Better yet, you won't be doing this alone.
Homebridge is an organization working to meet IHSS recipients' needs within the city & county of San Francisco. We prepare care providers to meet those needs with our nationally-recognized training program, tools, and support system to keep our community safe.

As a Direct Care Professional, you are accountable to the Residential Coordinator and Group Home Manager assigned to the home in which you work. The Direct Care Professional position is relied upon for ethical implementation of services and support. Since you will be interacting with numerous professionals on a frequent basis, you are expected to represent yourself and Universal Institute in a positive, professional manner at all times. You will be a part of the clients’ interdisciplinary team.
Universal Institute is a leading provider of rehabilitation and supportive-living services to individuals with brain and spinal cord injuries and other neurological conditions. Our home and community-based platform offers Client-centered services with concentration of Activities of Daily Living and Community Reintegration. In addition to physical impairments, our population often has difficulty with attention, concentration, memory, organizational skills, perception, expressing feelings, and at times inappropriate behaviors. At UIRehab, our objective is to encourage our Clients to work toward their personal goals while developing and maintaining the self-assurance to live as independently as possible.

Job Title: Home Care Provider I
Job Description:
Are you looking for a way to aid your community in a time of need? Are you an experienced family or independent caregiver looking for training and career advancement opportunities? If yes, then apply now for the Home Care Provider I position with Homebridge.
Under the direction of a Care Supervisor and Manager of Care Teams, Home Care Providers (HCPs) provide in-home caregiving services to aging adults and people with disabilities in San Francisco with complex social and behavioral support needs. By supporting recipients with their activities of daily living in and around their homes, we are making independent living possible, keeping our hospitals and clinics clear. Care providers are essential to addressing our public health crisis.
Better yet, you won't be doing this alone.
Homebridge is an organization working to meet IHSS recipients' needs within the city & county of San Francisco. We prepare care providers to meet those needs with our nationally-recognized training program, tools, and support system to keep our community safe.

Job Title: Certified Home Health Aide (CHHA)

Harmony Home Health is Medicare-Certified and State-Licensed.
The responsibilities of the Certified Home Health Aide include:
Providing personal care according to the care plan or as directed by RN, PT, OT: Baths, Back rubs, Oral hygiene, Shampoos, Changing bed linen, Assisting patients with dressing and undressing, Skin care to prevent breakdown, Assisting the patient with toileting activities, Keeping patient’s living area clean and orderly, as appropriate
Assisting in feeding the patient, if necessary.
Taking and recording oral, rectal and axillary temperatures, pulse, respiration and blood pressure when ordered (with appropriate completed/demonstrated skills competency).

Job Title: Home Care Provider I
Job Description:
Are you looking for a way to aid your community in a time of need? Are you an experienced family or independent caregiver looking for training and career advancement opportunities? If yes, then apply now for the Home Care Provider I position with Homebridge.
Under the direction of a Care Supervisor and Manager of Care Teams, Home Care Providers (HCPs) provide in-home caregiving services to aging adults and people with disabilities in San Francisco with complex social and behavioral support needs. By supporting recipients with their activities of daily living in and around their homes, we are making independent living possible, keeping our hospitals and clinics clear. Care providers are essential to addressing our public health crisis.
Better yet, you won't be doing this alone.
Homebridge is an organization working to meet IHSS recipients' needs within the city & county of San Francisco. We prepare care providers to meet those needs with our nationally-recognized training program, tools, and support system to keep our community safe.

Job Title: Home Health Aide
Job Description:
We are actively seeking a full time Certified Home Health Aide to join our rapidly growing clinical team providing best-in-class hospice service to our patients and their families. Be the critical part of our team and make a difference by helping those with life-limiting illness to live their best life.
Responsibilities:
Completes charting and completion of appropriate documentation timely.
Assists patients with bath, mouth care, skin, hair and all aspects of personal hygiene.
Assists patients with transferring and ambulation as needed.
Assists with prescribed exercises which patients and CHHA have been educated in by appropriate health professionals.
Prepares meals and assists patients with eating as required.

Job Title: Certified Home Health Aide (CHHA)
Job Description:
Harmony Home Health seeks a Per-Diem Certified Home Health Aide to join its dynamic team of healthcare professionals in the Contra Costa County, East Bay, Daly City, Half Moon Bay, Peninsula, San Francisco, San Mateo, Santa Clara, Pleasant Hill and Richmond areas. Harmony Home Health is Medicare-Certified and State-Licensed.
The responsibilities of the Certified Home Health Aide include:
Providing personal care according to the care plan or as directed by RN, PT, OT: Baths, Back rubs, Oral hygiene, Shampoos, Changing bed linen, Assisting patients with dressing and undressing, Skin care to prevent breakdown, Assisting the patient with toileting activities, Keeping patient’s living area clean and orderly, as appropriate
Assisting in feeding the patient, if necessary.
Taking and recording oral, rectal and axillary temperatures, pulse, respiration and blood pressure when ordered (with appropriate completed/demonstrated skills competency).

Providing personal care according to the care plan or as directed by RN, PT, OT: Baths, Back rubs, Oral hygiene, Shampoos, Changing bed linen, Assisting patients with dressing and undressing, Skin care to prevent breakdown, Assisting the patient with toileting activities, Keeping patient’s living area clean and orderly, as appropriate

Job Title: Hospice Home Health Aide (Branson) *Sign on Bonus!
Job Description:
Summary

Life is precious, and maybe no time in life is more precious than then end of life – for patients, and for those they love. Rather than working to cure or fix patients, hospice aides working as part of an interdisciplinary team, provide care and compassion to ensure terminally ill or dying patients have comfort and quality in their remaining days. CoxHealth at Home considers home care a calling, and that providing end-of-life care as both an honor and privilege for those who serve as hospice aides.

1906 Employee Store

Cafeteria discount

Education

BLS must be obtained within 90 days

Job Title: Private Home Caregiver
Job Description:
Looking for care/assistance for a successful retirement age businessman. He started from scratch a cattle/farming operation that spans a multi-state area but has had some major setbacks in overall health. He does not want to slow down in everyday life and wants to continue being involved with the family business. He needs assistance with his daily tasks. The job site/home is just south of Overland Park, KS in town of Bucyrus, KS.
He is struggling with his oxygen levels upon exertion. He requires a walker to move around the house and needs assistance getting up out of a chair. He is very quick-witted with an ornery personality. He enjoys having fun with others. Caregiver must have some thick skin and be willing to handle some of his moments of being frustrated with his current condition.
You will be tasked with helping the patient with personal hygiene, minor medical needs, housekeeping, and other daily needs as required by the patient. To excel in this role, you should have an interest in health care as well as an interest in the patient's happiness/well-being. We are looking for a caring individual who has the ability to work with limited supervision while keeping the patient's needs as your top priority.

Job Title: Certified Home Health Aide (CHHA)
Job Description:
Harmony Home Health seeks a Per-Diem Certified Home Health Aide to join its dynamic team of healthcare professionals in the Contra Costa County, East Bay, Daly City, Half Moon Bay, Peninsula, San Francisco, San Mateo, Santa Clara, Pleasant Hill and Richmond areas. Harmony Home Health is Medicare-Certified and State-Licensed.
The responsibilities of the Certified Home Health Aide include:
Providing personal care according to the care plan or as directed by RN, PT, OT: Baths, Back rubs, Oral hygiene, Shampoos, Changing bed linen, Assisting patients with dressing and undressing, Skin care to prevent breakdown, Assisting the patient with toileting activities, Keeping patient’s living area clean and orderly, as appropriate
Assisting in feeding the patient, if necessary.
Taking and recording oral, rectal and axillary temperatures, pulse, respiration and blood pressure when ordered (with appropriate completed/demonstrated skills competency).

Your goal is to provide for their safety and to help them live as independently as possible in their own home. Our team is here to support you in this mission and provide you with the referrals for clients.

1+ year(s) of experience caring for elders.
CNA/PCA certification preferred but not required.

Job Title: Home Care Provider I
Job Description:
Are you looking for a way to aid your community in a time of need? Are you an experienced family or independent caregiver looking for training and career advancement opportunities? If yes, then apply now for the Home Care Provider I position with Homebridge.
Under the direction of a Care Supervisor and Manager of Care Teams, Home Care Providers (HCPs) provide in-home caregiving services to aging adults and people with disabilities in San Francisco with complex social and behavioral support needs. By supporting recipients with their activities of daily living in and around their homes, we are making independent living possible, keeping our hospitals and clinics clear. Care providers are essential to addressing our public health crisis.
Better yet, you won't be doing this alone.
Homebridge is an organization working to meet IHSS recipients' needs within the city & county of San Francisco. We prepare care providers to meet those needs with our nationally-recognized training program, tools, and support system to keep our community safe.

What You Will Do:
As a home health physical therapist, you will provide one on one treatment and care to patients in their home using a comprehensive and patient specific care plan, innovative solutions, and a preferred technology for point of care documentation. You will have the opportunity to spend quality time with the patient, in their own home, to promote their health and independence. You will have autonomy in addition to the support and collaboration of a full team of healthcare professionals.

Job Title: Private Home Caregiver
Job Description:
Looking for care/assistance for a successful retirement age businessman. He started from scratch a cattle/farming operation that spans a multi-state area but has had some major setbacks in overall health. He does not want to slow down in everyday life and wants to continue being involved with the family business. He needs assistance with his daily tasks. The job site/home is just south of Overland Park, KS in town of Bucyrus, KS.
He is struggling with his oxygen levels upon exertion. He requires a walker to move around the house and needs assistance getting up out of a chair. He is very quick-witted with an ornery personality. He enjoys having fun with others. Caregiver must have some thick skin and be willing to handle some of his moments of being frustrated with his current condition.
You will be tasked with helping the patient with personal hygiene, minor medical needs, housekeeping, and other daily needs as required by the patient. To excel in this role, you should have an interest in health care as well as an interest in the patient's happiness/well-being. We are looking for a caring individual who has the ability to work with limited supervision while keeping the patient's needs as your top priority.

Job Title: Private Home Caregiver
Job Description:
Looking for care/assistance for a successful retirement age businessman. He started from scratch a cattle/farming operation that spans a multi-state area but has had some major setbacks in overall health. He does not want to slow down in everyday life and wants to continue being involved with the family business. He needs assistance with his daily tasks. The job site/home is just south of Overland Park, KS in town of Bucyrus, KS.
He is struggling with his oxygen levels upon exertion. He requires a walker to move around the house and needs assistance getting up out of a chair. He is very quick-witted with an ornery personality. He enjoys having fun with others. Caregiver must have some thick skin and be willing to handle some of his moments of being frustrated with his current condition.
You will be tasked with helping the patient with personal hygiene, minor medical needs, housekeeping, and other daily needs as required by the patient. To excel in this role, you should have an interest in health care as well as an interest in the patient's happiness/well-being. We are looking for a caring individual who has the ability to work with limited supervision while keeping the patient's needs as your top priority.

As a home health physical therapist, you will provide one on one treatment and care to patients in their home using a comprehensive and patient specific care plan, innovative solutions, and a preferred technology for point of care documentation. Cooperatively utilize varied solutions to educate and promote the health and independence of the patient

Job Title: Private Home Caregiver
Job Description:
Looking for care/assistance for a successful retirement age businessman. He started from scratch a cattle/farming operation that spans a multi-state area but has had some major setbacks in overall health. He does not want to slow down in everyday life and wants to continue being involved with the family business. He needs assistance with his daily tasks. The job site/home is just south of Overland Park, KS in town of Bucyrus, KS.
He is struggling with his oxygen levels upon exertion. He requires a walker to move around the house and needs assistance getting up out of a chair. He is very quick-witted with an ornery personality. He enjoys having fun with others. Caregiver must have some thick skin and be willing to handle some of his moments of being frustrated with his current condition.
You will be tasked with helping the patient with personal hygiene, minor medical needs, housekeeping, and other daily needs as required by the patient. To excel in this role, you should have an interest in health care as well as an interest in the patient's happiness/well-being. We are looking for a caring individual who has the ability to work with limited supervision while keeping the patient's needs as your top priority.

Job Title: Home Care Provider I
Job Description:
Are you looking for a way to aid your community in a time of need? Are you an experienced family or independent caregiver looking for training and career advancement opportunities? If yes, then apply now for the Home Care Provider I position with Homebridge.
Under the direction of a Care Supervisor and Manager of Care Teams, Home Care Providers (HCPs) provide in-home caregiving services to aging adults and people with disabilities in San Francisco with complex social and behavioral support needs. By supporting recipients with their activities of daily living in and around their homes, we are making independent living possible, keeping our hospitals and clinics clear. Care providers are essential to addressing our public health crisis.
Better yet, you won't be doing this alone.
Homebridge is an organization working to meet IHSS recipients' needs within the city & county of San Francisco. We prepare care providers to meet those needs with our nationally-recognized training program, tools, and support system to keep our community safe.

Job Title: Private Home Caregiver
Job Description:
Looking for care/assistance for a successful retirement age businessman. He started from scratch a cattle/farming operation that spans a multi-state area but has had some major setbacks in overall health. He does not want to slow down in everyday life and wants to continue being involved with the family business. He needs assistance with his daily tasks. The job site/home is just south of Overland Park, KS in town of Bucyrus, KS.
He is struggling with his oxygen levels upon exertion. He requires a walker to move around the house and needs assistance getting up out of a chair. He is very quick-witted with an ornery personality. He enjoys having fun with others. Caregiver must have some thick skin and be willing to handle some of his moments of being frustrated with his current condition.
You will be tasked with helping the patient with personal hygiene, minor medical needs, housekeeping, and other daily needs as required by the patient. To excel in this role, you should have an interest in health care as well as an interest in the patient's happiness/well-being. We are looking for a caring individual who has the ability to work with limited supervision while keeping the patient's needs as your top priority.

Job Title: Private Home Caregiver
Job Description:
Looking for care/assistance for a successful retirement age businessman. He started from scratch a cattle/farming operation that spans a multi-state area but has had some major setbacks in overall health. He does not want to slow down in everyday life and wants to continue being involved with the family business. He needs assistance with his daily tasks. The job site/home is just south of Overland Park, KS in town of Bucyrus, KS.
He is struggling with his oxygen levels upon exertion. He requires a walker to move around the house and needs assistance getting up out of a chair. He is very quick-witted with an ornery personality. He enjoys having fun with others. Caregiver must have some thick skin and be willing to handle some of his moments of being frustrated with his current condition.
You will be tasked with helping the patient with personal hygiene, minor medical needs, housekeeping, and other daily needs as required by the patient. To excel in this role, you should have an interest in health care as well as an interest in the patient's happiness/well-being. We are looking for a caring individual who has the ability to work with limited supervision while keeping the patient's needs as your top priority.

Job Description:

Providence is calling a Certified Home Health Aide - Hospice (Full time/Day Shift) to Providence TrinityCare Hospice in Torrance and Cerritos, CA.

We are seeking a Certified Home Health Aide - Hospice who will work under the supervision of a Registered Nurse and the Continuous Care Clinical Supervisor. The Continuous Care Hospice CHHA will perform various services for a patient as is necessary to meet the patient's personal needs and to promote comfort following the CHHA plan of care developed by the registered nurse in collaboration with the interdisciplinary team/group (IDG). The Continuous Care Hospice Certified Home Health Aide will be responsible for observing the patient, reporting these observations and documenting observations and care performed. The Continuous Care Hospice Certified Home Health Aide will be assigned to provide continuous nursing care to the patient during times of medical crisis, as directed in the Plan of Care, in a manner that promotes the quality, continuity and safety of a patient's care. The Continuous Care Certified Home Health Aide will be available for a minimum of 16 hours a week for continuous care assignments. May provide care to premature infants, infants, pediatrics, adolescents, young, middle and young adults.

Under the direction of a Care Supervisor and Manager of Care Teams, Home Care Providers (HCPs) provide in-home caregiving services to aging adults and people with disabilities in San Francisco with complex social and behavioral support needs. By supporting recipients with their activities of daily living in and around their homes, we are making independent living possible, keeping our hospitals and clinics clear. Care providers are essential to addressing our public health crisis.
Better yet, you won't be doing this alone.
Homebridge is an organization working to meet IHSS recipients' needs within the city & county of San Francisco. We prepare care providers to meet those needs with our nationally-recognized training program, tools, and support system to keep our community safe.

Job Title: Private Home Caregiver
Job Description:
Looking for care/assistance for a successful retirement age businessman. He started from scratch a cattle/farming operation that spans a multi-state area but has had some major setbacks in overall health. He does not want to slow down in everyday life and wants to continue being involved with the family business. He needs assistance with his daily tasks. The job site/home is just south of Overland Park, KS in town of Bucyrus, KS.
He is struggling with his oxygen levels upon exertion. He requires a walker to move around the house and needs assistance getting up out of a chair. He is very quick-witted with an ornery personality. He enjoys having fun with others. Caregiver must have some thick skin and be willing to handle some of his moments of being frustrated with his current condition.
You will be tasked with helping the patient with personal hygiene, minor medical needs, housekeeping, and other daily needs as required by the patient. To excel in this role, you should have an interest in health care as well as an interest in the patient's happiness/well-being. We are looking for a caring individual who has the ability to work with limited supervision while keeping the patient's needs as your top priority.

Job Title: Private Home Caregiver
Job Description:
Looking for care/assistance for a successful retirement age businessman. He started from scratch a cattle/farming operation that spans a multi-state area but has had some major setbacks in overall health. He does not want to slow down in everyday life and wants to continue being involved with the family business. He needs assistance with his daily tasks. The job site/home is just south of Overland Park, KS in town of Bucyrus, KS.
He is struggling with his oxygen levels upon exertion. He requires a walker to move around the house and needs assistance getting up out of a chair. He is very quick-witted with an ornery personality. He enjoys having fun with others. Caregiver must have some thick skin and be willing to handle some of his moments of being frustrated with his current condition.
You will be tasked with helping the patient with personal hygiene, minor medical needs, housekeeping, and other daily needs as required by the patient. To excel in this role, you should have an interest in health care as well as an interest in the patient's happiness/well-being. We are looking for a caring individual who has the ability to work with limited supervision while keeping the patient's needs as your top priority.

Job Title: Certified Home Health Aide (CHHA)
Job Description:
Harmony Home Health seeks a Per-Diem Certified Home Health Aide to join its dynamic team of healthcare professionals in the Contra Costa County, East Bay, Daly City, Half Moon Bay, Peninsula, San Francisco, San Mateo, Santa Clara, Pleasant Hill and Richmond areas. Harmony Home Health is Medicare-Certified and State-Licensed.
The responsibilities of the Certified Home Health Aide include:
Providing personal care according to the care plan or as directed by RN, PT, OT: Baths, Back rubs, Oral hygiene, Shampoos, Changing bed linen, Assisting patients with dressing and undressing, Skin care to prevent breakdown, Assisting the patient with toileting activities, Keeping patient’s living area clean and orderly, as appropriate
Assisting in feeding the patient, if necessary.
Taking and recording oral, rectal and axillary temperatures, pulse, respiration and blood pressure when ordered (with appropriate completed/demonstrated skills competency).

Taking and recording oral, rectal and axillary temperatures, pulse, respiration and blood pressure when ordered (with appropriate completed/demonstrated skills competency).

The Continuous Care Hospice Certified Home Health Aide will be responsible for observing the patient, reporting these observations and documenting observations and care performed. The Continuous Care Hospice Certified Home Health Aide will be assigned to provide continuous nursing care to the patient during times of medical crisis, as directed in the Plan of Care, in a manner that promotes the quality, continuity and safety of a patient's care. The Continuous Care Certified Home Health Aide will be available for a minimum of 16 hours a week for continuous care assignments. May provide care to premature infants, infants, pediatrics, adolescents, young, middle and young adults.

Job Title: Home Care Provider I
Job Description:
Are you looking for a way to aid your community in a time of need? Are you an experienced family or independent caregiver looking for training and career advancement opportunities? If yes, then apply now for the Home Care Provider I position with Homebridge.
Under the direction of a Care Supervisor and Manager of Care Teams, Home Care Providers (HCPs) provide in-home caregiving services to aging adults and people with disabilities in San Francisco with complex social and behavioral support needs. By supporting recipients with their activities of daily living in and around their homes, we are making independent living possible, keeping our hospitals and clinics clear. Care providers are essential to addressing our public health crisis.
Better yet, you won't be doing this alone.
Homebridge is an organization working to meet IHSS recipients' needs within the city & county of San Francisco. We prepare care providers to meet those needs with our nationally-recognized training program, tools, and support system to keep our community safe.

Job Title: Private Home Caregiver
Job Description:
Looking for care/assistance for a successful retirement age businessman. He started from scratch a cattle/farming operation that spans a multi-state area but has had some major setbacks in overall health. He does not want to slow down in everyday life and wants to continue being involved with the family business. He needs assistance with his daily tasks. The job site/home is just south of Overland Park, KS in town of Bucyrus, KS.
He is struggling with his oxygen levels upon exertion. He requires a walker to move around the house and needs assistance getting up out of a chair. He is very quick-witted with an ornery personality. He enjoys having fun with others. Caregiver must have some thick skin and be willing to handle some of his moments of being frustrated with his current condition.
You will be tasked with helping the patient with personal hygiene, minor medical needs, housekeeping, and other daily needs as required by the patient. To excel in this role, you should have an interest in health care as well as an interest in the patient's happiness/well-being. We are looking for a caring individual who has the ability to work with limited supervision while keeping the patient's needs as your top priority.

Job Title: CNA/PCA/HHA and Caregivers needed
Job Description:
Griswold Home Care is seeking exceptional CNA/PCA/HHA/Companions who want to make a difference in the lives of others as a compassionate provider of care! A typical day for you includes supporting the individual with their personal needs by providing companionship, reducing loneliness, assist with bathing, continence/incontinence care, verbal cue’s if memory challenges are present, transporting or running errands, and helping the individual with healthy nutrition. Your goal is to provide for their safety and to help them live as independently as possible in their own home. Our team is here to support you in this mission and provide you with the referrals for clients.
CNA/PCA/HHA/Companion Qualifications our clients are looking for:
1+ year(s) of experience caring for elders.
CNA/PCA certification preferred but not required.

Prepares meals and assists patients with eating as required.

Job Description:
Are you looking for a way to aid your community in a time of need? Are you an experienced family or independent caregiver looking for training and career advancement opportunities? If yes, then apply now for the Home Care Provider I position with Homebridge.
Under the direction of a Care Supervisor and Manager of Care Teams, Home Care Providers (HCPs) provide in-home caregiving services to aging adults and people with disabilities in San Francisco with complex social and behavioral support needs. By supporting recipients with their activities of daily living in and around their homes, we are making independent living possible, keeping our hospitals and clinics clear. Care providers are essential to addressing our public health crisis.
Better yet, you won't be doing this alone.
Homebridge is an organization working to meet IHSS recipients' needs within the city & county of San Francisco. We prepare care providers to meet those needs with our nationally-recognized training program, tools, and support system to keep our community safe.

Job Title: Private Home Caregiver
Job Description:
Looking for care/assistance for a successful retirement age businessman. He started from scratch a cattle/farming operation that spans a multi-state area but has had some major setbacks in overall health. He does not want to slow down in everyday life and wants to continue being involved with the family business. He needs assistance with his daily tasks. The job site/home is just south of Overland Park, KS in town of Bucyrus, KS.
He is struggling with his oxygen levels upon exertion. He requires a walker to move around the house and needs assistance getting up out of a chair. He is very quick-witted with an ornery personality. He enjoys having fun with others. Caregiver must have some thick skin and be willing to handle some of his moments of being frustrated with his current condition.
You will be tasked with helping the patient with personal hygiene, minor medical needs, housekeeping, and other daily needs as required by the patient. To excel in this role, you should have an interest in health care as well as an interest in the patient's happiness/well-being. We are looking for a caring individual who has the ability to work with limited supervision while keeping the patient's needs as your top priority.

Job Title: Private Home Caregiver
Job Description:
Looking for care/assistance for a successful retirement age businessman. He started from scratch a cattle/farming operation that spans a multi-state area but has had some major setbacks in overall health. He does not want to slow down in everyday life and wants to continue being involved with the family business. He needs assistance with his daily tasks. The job site/home is just south of Overland Park, KS in town of Bucyrus, KS.
He is struggling with his oxygen levels upon exertion. He requires a walker to move around the house and needs assistance getting up out of a chair. He is very quick-witted with an ornery personality. He enjoys having fun with others. Caregiver must have some thick skin and be willing to handle some of his moments of being frustrated with his current condition.
You will be tasked with helping the patient with personal hygiene, minor medical needs, housekeeping, and other daily needs as required by the patient. To excel in this role, you should have an interest in health care as well as an interest in the patient's happiness/well-being. We are looking for a caring individual who has the ability to work with limited supervision while keeping the patient's needs as your top priority.

Job Title: Physical Therapist Aide for Home Health
Job Description:
What You Will Do:
As a home health physical therapist, you will provide one on one treatment and care to patients in their home using a comprehensive and patient specific care plan, innovative solutions, and a preferred technology for point of care documentation. You will have the opportunity to spend quality time with the patient, in their own home, to promote their health and independence. You will have autonomy in addition to the support and collaboration of a full team of healthcare professionals.
Collaborate with physicians, patients and their families, nurses, therapists, social workers and other members of the patient care team to develop and implement a patient specific care and treatment plan
Cooperatively utilize varied solutions to educate and promote the health and independence of the patient

The Continuous Care Hospice CHHA will perform various services for a patient as is necessary to meet the patient's personal needs and to promote comfort following the CHHA plan of care developed by the registered nurse in collaboration with the interdisciplinary team/group (IDG). Job Title: Private Home Caregiver
Job Description:
Looking for care/assistance for a successful retirement age businessman. He started from scratch a cattle/farming operation that spans a multi-state area but has had some major setbacks in overall health. He does not want to slow down in everyday life and wants to continue being involved with the family business. He needs assistance with his daily tasks. The job site/home is just south of Overland Park, KS in town of Bucyrus, KS.
He is struggling with his oxygen levels upon exertion. He requires a walker to move around the house and needs assistance getting up out of a chair. He is very quick-witted with an ornery personality. He enjoys having fun with others. Caregiver must have some thick skin and be willing to handle some of his moments of being frustrated with his current condition.
You will be tasked with helping the patient with personal hygiene, minor medical needs, housekeeping, and other daily needs as required by the patient. To excel in this role, you should have an interest in health care as well as an interest in the patient's happiness/well-being. We are looking for a caring individual who has the ability to work with limited supervision while keeping the patient's needs as your top priority.

Job Title: Physical Therapist Aide for Home Health
Job Description:
What You Will Do:
As a home health physical therapist, you will provide one on one treatment and care to patients in their home using a comprehensive and patient specific care plan, innovative solutions, and a preferred technology for point of care documentation. You will have the opportunity to spend quality time with the patient, in their own home, to promote their health and independence. You will have autonomy in addition to the support and collaboration of a full team of healthcare professionals.
Collaborate with physicians, patients and their families, nurses, therapists, social workers and other members of the patient care team to develop and implement a patient specific care and treatment plan
Cooperatively utilize varied solutions to educate and promote the health and independence of the patient

We are seeking a Certified Home Health Aide - Hospice who will work under the supervision of a Registered Nurse and the Continuous Care Clinical Supervisor. The Continuous Care Hospice CHHA will perform various services for a patient as is necessary to meet the patient's personal needs and to promote comfort following the CHHA plan of care developed by the registered nurse in collaboration with the interdisciplinary team/group (IDG). The Continuous Care Hospice Certified Home Health Aide will be responsible for observing the patient, reporting these observations and documenting observations and care performed. The Continuous Care Hospice Certified Home Health Aide will be assigned to provide continuous nursing care to the patient during times of medical crisis, as directed in the Plan of Care, in a manner that promotes the quality, continuity and safety of a patient's care. The Continuous Care Certified Home Health Aide will be available for a minimum of 16 hours a week for continuous care assignments. May provide care to premature infants, infants, pediatrics, adolescents, young, middle and young adults.

Job Title: Private Home Caregiver
Job Description:
Looking for care/assistance for a successful retirement age businessman. He started from scratch a cattle/farming operation that spans a multi-state area but has had some major setbacks in overall health. He does not want to slow down in everyday life and wants to continue being involved with the family business. He needs assistance with his daily tasks. The job site/home is just south of Overland Park, KS in town of Bucyrus, KS.
He is struggling with his oxygen levels upon exertion. He requires a walker to move around the house and needs assistance getting up out of a chair. He is very quick-witted with an ornery personality. He enjoys having fun with others. Caregiver must have some thick skin and be willing to handle some of his moments of being frustrated with his current condition.
You will be tasked with helping the patient with personal hygiene, minor medical needs, housekeeping, and other daily needs as required by the patient. To excel in this role, you should have an interest in health care as well as an interest in the patient's happiness/well-being. We are looking for a caring individual who has the ability to work with limited supervision while keeping the patient's needs as your top priority.

Job Title: Hospice Home Health Aide (Branson) *Sign on Bonus!
Job Description:
Summary

Life is precious, and maybe no time in life is more precious than then end of life – for patients, and for those they love. Rather than working to cure or fix patients, hospice aides working as part of an interdisciplinary team, provide care and compassion to ensure terminally ill or dying patients have comfort and quality in their remaining days. CoxHealth at Home considers home care a calling, and that providing end-of-life care as both an honor and privilege for those who serve as hospice aides.

Job Perks & Benefits:
Tuition reimbursement up to $1,200 per year

Health/Dental/Vision

Retirement with employer match

On-site daycare with extended hours, holidays and weekends

On-site fitness facilities

Pharmacy delivery to your department

On-site Employee Health services

1906 Employee Store

20% tuition discount on most classes at Cox College

Cafeteria discount

Job Summary

Provides in home personal care services and other designated health-related services according to written and/or verbal directions prepared by registered professional personnel.

Job Requirements

Education

Completion of Home Health Aide competency test to be administered by CoxHealth at Home staff before Hire.

Completion of Home Health Aide basic skills test to be administered by CoxHealth at Home staff within 90 days of hire.

Experience

Six months of paid experience as an agency caregiver.

Skills

Ability to follow directions and perform duties with minimum supervision.

Exhibit sympathetic attitude toward the care of the sick.

Ability to provide reliable transportation as required by nature of position.

Licensure/Certification/Registration

BLS must be obtained within 90 days

Job Title: Certified Home Health Aide - Hospice - $1,500 sign-on bonus! Virtual Hiring Event
Job Description:
$1,500 Sign-On Bonus!

Providence is calling a Certified Home Health Aide - Hospice (Full time/Day Shift) to Providence TrinityCare Hospice in Torrance and Cerritos, CA.

We are seeking a Certified Home Health Aide - Hospice who will work under the supervision of a Registered Nurse and the Continuous Care Clinical Supervisor. The Continuous Care Hospice CHHA will perform various services for a patient as is necessary to meet the patient's personal needs and to promote comfort following the CHHA plan of care developed by the registered nurse in collaboration with the interdisciplinary team/group (IDG). The Continuous Care Hospice Certified Home Health Aide will be responsible for observing the patient, reporting these observations and documenting observations and care performed. The Continuous Care Hospice Certified Home Health Aide will be assigned to provide continuous nursing care to the patient during times of medical crisis, as directed in the Plan of Care, in a manner that promotes the quality, continuity and safety of a patient's care. The Continuous Care Certified Home Health Aide will be available for a minimum of 16 hours a week for continuous care assignments. May provide care to premature infants, infants, pediatrics, adolescents, young, middle and young adults.

Job Title: Private Home Caregiver
Job Description:
Looking for care/assistance for a successful retirement age businessman. He started from scratch a cattle/farming operation that spans a multi-state area but has had some major setbacks in overall health. He does not want to slow down in everyday life and wants to continue being involved with the family business. He needs assistance with his daily tasks. The job site/home is just south of Overland Park, KS in town of Bucyrus, KS.
He is struggling with his oxygen levels upon exertion. He requires a walker to move around the house and needs assistance getting up out of a chair. He is very quick-witted with an ornery personality. He enjoys having fun with others. Caregiver must have some thick skin and be willing to handle some of his moments of being frustrated with his current condition.
You will be tasked with helping the patient with personal hygiene, minor medical needs, housekeeping, and other daily needs as required by the patient. To excel in this role, you should have an interest in health care as well as an interest in the patient's happiness/well-being. We are looking for a caring individual who has the ability to work with limited supervision while keeping the patient's needs as your top priority.

Job Title: Certified Home Health Aide - Hospice - $1,500 sign-on bonus! Virtual Hiring Event
Job Description:
$1,500 Sign-On Bonus!

Providence is calling a Certified Home Health Aide - Hospice (Full time/Day Shift) to Providence TrinityCare Hospice in Torrance and Cerritos, CA.

We are seeking a Certified Home Health Aide - Hospice who will work under the supervision of a Registered Nurse and the Continuous Care Clinical Supervisor. The Continuous Care Hospice CHHA will perform various services for a patient as is necessary to meet the patient's personal needs and to promote comfort following the CHHA plan of care developed by the registered nurse in collaboration with the interdisciplinary team/group (IDG). The Continuous Care Hospice Certified Home Health Aide will be responsible for observing the patient, reporting these observations and documenting observations and care performed. The Continuous Care Hospice Certified Home Health Aide will be assigned to provide continuous nursing care to the patient during times of medical crisis, as directed in the Plan of Care, in a manner that promotes the quality, continuity and safety of a patient's care. The Continuous Care Certified Home Health Aide will be available for a minimum of 16 hours a week for continuous care assignments. May provide care to premature infants, infants, pediatrics, adolescents, young, middle and young adults.

We are seeking a Certified Home Health Aide - Hospice who will work under the supervision of a Registered Nurse and the Continuous Care Clinical Supervisor. The Continuous Care Hospice CHHA will perform various services for a patient as is necessary to meet the patient's personal needs and to promote comfort following the CHHA plan of care developed by the registered nurse in collaboration with the interdisciplinary team/group (IDG). The Continuous Care Hospice Certified Home Health Aide will be responsible for observing the patient, reporting these observations and documenting observations and care performed. The Continuous Care Hospice Certified Home Health Aide will be assigned to provide continuous nursing care to the patient during times of medical crisis, as directed in the Plan of Care, in a manner that promotes the quality, continuity and safety of a patient's care. The Continuous Care Certified Home Health Aide will be available for a minimum of 16 hours a week for continuous care assignments. May provide care to premature infants, infants, pediatrics, adolescents, young, middle and young adults.

Job Summary
Flexible schedule position that provides clients with assistance and companionship while recognizing clients’ individual needs and encourages independence.
Essential Functions
1. Non-medical hands on care; including dressing, bathing, grooming, personal care and assistance with transfers.
2. Provides one on one companionship to client.
3. May assist clients with medication as defined in medication procedure.
4. Performs general housekeeping following cleaning schedules for client laundry, bedrooms, dining area, living space, bathrooms, kitchen, etc.
5. Assists with pet care as needed.
6. Provides transportation to doctor's appointments and other errands.
7. Attends and participates in required training.
8. Maintains client confidentiality.
9. Communicates effectively with the clients, families, collaborative team. Notifying the manager of any changes in client condition / status.
10. Provides personal care to clients per their individualized plan of care.
This job description represents an overview of the responsibilities for the above referenced position. It is not intended to represent a comprehensive list of responsibilities. An associate should perform all duties as assigned by his/ her supervisor.

Job Title: Certified Home Health Aide - Hospice - $1,500 sign-on bonus! Virtual Hiring Event
Job Description:
$1,500 Sign-On Bonus!

Providence is calling a Certified Home Health Aide - Hospice (Full time/Day Shift) to Providence TrinityCare Hospice in Torrance and Cerritos, CA.

We are seeking a Certified Home Health Aide - Hospice who will work under the supervision of a Registered Nurse and the Continuous Care Clinical Supervisor. The Continuous Care Hospice CHHA will perform various services for a patient as is necessary to meet the patient's personal needs and to promote comfort following the CHHA plan of care developed by the registered nurse in collaboration with the interdisciplinary team/group (IDG). The Continuous Care Hospice Certified Home Health Aide will be responsible for observing the patient, reporting these observations and documenting observations and care performed. The Continuous Care Hospice Certified Home Health Aide will be assigned to provide continuous nursing care to the patient during times of medical crisis, as directed in the Plan of Care, in a manner that promotes the quality, continuity and safety of a patient's care. The Continuous Care Certified Home Health Aide will be available for a minimum of 16 hours a week for continuous care assignments. May provide care to premature infants, infants, pediatrics, adolescents, young, middle and young adults.

Summary

Life is precious, and maybe no time in life is more precious than then end of life – for patients, and for those they love. CoxHealth at Home considers home care a calling, and that providing end-of-life care as both an honor and privilege for those who serve as hospice aides.

We are seeking a Certified Home Health Aide - Hospice who will work under the supervision of a Registered Nurse and the Continuous Care Clinical Supervisor. The Continuous Care Hospice CHHA will perform various services for a patient as is necessary to meet the patient's personal needs and to promote comfort following the CHHA plan of care developed by the registered nurse in collaboration with the interdisciplinary team/group (IDG). The Continuous Care Hospice Certified Home Health Aide will be responsible for observing the patient, reporting these observations and documenting observations and care performed. The Continuous Care Hospice Certified Home Health Aide will be assigned to provide continuous nursing care to the patient during times of medical crisis, as directed in the Plan of Care, in a manner that promotes the quality, continuity and safety of a patient's care. The Continuous Care Certified Home Health Aide will be available for a minimum of 16 hours a week for continuous care assignments. May provide care to premature infants, infants, pediatrics, adolescents, young, middle and young adults.

Job Title: Private Duty Home Care Aide
Job Description:
Make Lives Better Including Your Own.
The happiness of those we serve is dependent on the happiness of our associates, so you’ll receive competitive compensation and a benefits package with additional perks designed to make you smile. But you’ll earn more than a paycheck; you can enjoy opportunities to grow your career, as well as ongoing programs catered to your health, financial, mental, and emotional needs. Most of all, we believe you can find purpose, meaning, and the chance to be a part of something bigger than yourself.
$1500 sign on bonus
Job Summary
Flexible schedule position that provides clients with assistance and companionship while recognizing clients’ individual needs and encourages independence.
Essential Functions
1. Non-medical hands on care; including dressing, bathing, grooming, personal care and assistance with transfers.
2. Provides one on one companionship to client.
3. May assist clients with medication as defined in medication procedure.
4. Performs general housekeeping following cleaning schedules for client laundry, bedrooms, dining area, living space, bathrooms, kitchen, etc.
5. Assists with pet care as needed.
6. Provides transportation to doctor's appointments and other errands.
7. Attends and participates in required training.
8. Maintains client confidentiality.
9. Communicates effectively with the clients, families, collaborative team. Notifying the manager of any changes in client condition / status.
10. Provides personal care to clients per their individualized plan of care.
This job description represents an overview of the responsibilities for the above referenced position. It is not intended to represent a comprehensive list of responsibilities. An associate should perform all duties as assigned by his/ her supervisor.

The Continuous Care Hospice CHHA will perform various services for a patient as is necessary to meet the patient's personal needs and to promote comfort following the CHHA plan of care developed by the registered nurse in collaboration with the interdisciplinary team/group (IDG). The Continuous Care Hospice Certified Home Health Aide will be responsible for observing the patient, reporting these observations and documenting observations and care performed. The Continuous Care Hospice Certified Home Health Aide will be assigned to provide continuous nursing care to the patient during times of medical crisis, as directed in the Plan of Care, in a manner that promotes the quality, continuity and safety of a patient's care. The Continuous Care Certified Home Health Aide will be available for a minimum of 16 hours a week for continuous care assignments. Job Summary
Flexible schedule position that provides clients with assistance and companionship while recognizing clients’ individual needs and encourages independence.
Essential Functions
1. Non-medical hands on care; including dressing, bathing, grooming, personal care and assistance with transfers.
2. Provides one on one companionship to client.
3. May assist clients with medication as defined in medication procedure.
4. Performs general housekeeping following cleaning schedules for client laundry, bedrooms, dining area, living space, bathrooms, kitchen, etc.
5. Assists with pet care as needed.
6. Provides transportation to doctor's appointments and other errands.
7. Attends and participates in required training.
8. Maintains client confidentiality.
9. Communicates effectively with the clients, families, collaborative team. Notifying the manager of any changes in client condition / status.
10. Provides personal care to clients per their individualized plan of care.
This job description represents an overview of the responsibilities for the above referenced position. It is not intended to represent a comprehensive list of responsibilities. An associate should perform all duties as assigned by his/ her supervisor.

Job Title: Hospice Home Health Aide (Branson) *Sign on Bonus!
Job Description:
Summary

Life is precious, and maybe no time in life is more precious than then end of life – for patients, and for those they love. Rather than working to cure or fix patients, hospice aides working as part of an interdisciplinary team, provide care and compassion to ensure terminally ill or dying patients have comfort and quality in their remaining days. CoxHealth at Home considers home care a calling, and that providing end-of-life care as both an honor and privilege for those who serve as hospice aides.

Job Perks & Benefits:
Tuition reimbursement up to $1,200 per year

Health/Dental/Vision

Retirement with employer match

On-site daycare with extended hours, holidays and weekends

On-site fitness facilities

Pharmacy delivery to your department

On-site Employee Health services

1906 Employee Store

20% tuition discount on most classes at Cox College

Cafeteria discount

Job Requirements

Education

Completion of Home Health Aide basic skills test to be administered by CoxHealth at Home staff within 90 days of hire.

Experience

Six months of paid experience as an agency caregiver.

Skills

Ability to follow directions and perform duties with minimum supervision.

Exhibit sympathetic attitude toward the care of the sick.

Ability to provide reliable transportation as required by nature of position.

Licensure/Certification/Registration

BLS must be obtained within 90 days

Home Health Aides provide assistance to clients with activities of daily living, such as dressing, grooming, toileting, moving safely to activities or functions, medication assistance and caring for the client's environment.
The ideal candidate for this position has a CNA certificate or equivalent training and Home health aide experience. Must have a genuine desire to work with the elderly and/or disabled. Job Description:
Griswold Home Care is seeking exceptional CNA/PCA/HHA/Companions who want to make a difference in the lives of others as a compassionate provider of care! A typical day for you includes supporting the individual with their personal needs by providing companionship, reducing loneliness, assist with bathing, continence/incontinence care, verbal cue’s if memory challenges are present, transporting or running errands, and helping the individual with healthy nutrition. Your goal is to provide for their safety and to help them live as independently as possible in their own home. Our team is here to support you in this mission and provide you with the referrals for clients.
CNA/PCA/HHA/Companion Qualifications our clients are looking for:
1+ year(s) of experience caring for elders.
CNA/PCA certification preferred but not required.

The responsibilities of the Certified Home Health Aide include:
Providing personal care according to the care plan or as directed by RN, PT, OT: Baths, Back rubs, Oral hygiene, Shampoos, Changing bed linen, Assisting patients with dressing and undressing, Skin care to prevent breakdown, Assisting the patient with toileting activities, Keeping patient’s living area clean and orderly, as appropriate

Taking and recording oral, rectal and axillary temperatures, pulse, respiration and blood pressure when ordered (with appropriate completed/demonstrated skills competency).

The happiness of those we serve is dependent on the happiness of our associates, so you’ll receive competitive compensation and a benefits package with additional perks designed to make you smile. Job Summary
Flexible schedule position that provides clients with assistance and companionship while recognizing clients’ individual needs and encourages independence.
Essential Functions
1. Non-medical hands on care; including dressing, bathing, grooming, personal care and assistance with transfers.
2. Provides one on one companionship to client.
3. May assist clients with medication as defined in medication procedure.
4. Performs general housekeeping following cleaning schedules for client laundry, bedrooms, dining area, living space, bathrooms, kitchen, etc.
5. Assists with pet care as needed.
6. Provides transportation to doctor's appointments and other errands.
7. Attends and participates in required training.
8. Maintains client confidentiality.
9. Communicates effectively with the clients, families, collaborative team. Notifying the manager of any changes in client condition / status.
10. Provides personal care to clients per their individualized plan of care.
This job description represents an overview of the responsibilities for the above referenced position. It is not intended to represent a comprehensive list of responsibilities. An associate should perform all duties as assigned by his/ her supervisor.

Job Title: Certified Home Health Aide - Hospice - $1,500 sign-on bonus! Virtual Hiring Event
Job Description:
$1,500 Sign-On Bonus!

Providence is calling a Certified Home Health Aide - Hospice (Full time/Day Shift) to Providence TrinityCare Hospice in Torrance and Cerritos, CA.

We are seeking a Certified Home Health Aide - Hospice who will work under the supervision of a Registered Nurse and the Continuous Care Clinical Supervisor. The Continuous Care Hospice CHHA will perform various services for a patient as is necessary to meet the patient's personal needs and to promote comfort following the CHHA plan of care developed by the registered nurse in collaboration with the interdisciplinary team/group (IDG). The Continuous Care Hospice Certified Home Health Aide will be responsible for observing the patient, reporting these observations and documenting observations and care performed. The Continuous Care Hospice Certified Home Health Aide will be assigned to provide continuous nursing care to the patient during times of medical crisis, as directed in the Plan of Care, in a manner that promotes the quality, continuity and safety of a patient's care. The Continuous Care Certified Home Health Aide will be available for a minimum of 16 hours a week for continuous care assignments. May provide care to premature infants, infants, pediatrics, adolescents, young, middle and young adults.

Job Title: Hospice Home Health Aide (Branson) *Sign on Bonus!
Job Description:
Summary

Life is precious, and maybe no time in life is more precious than then end of life – for patients, and for those they love. Rather than working to cure or fix patients, hospice aides working as part of an interdisciplinary team, provide care and compassion to ensure terminally ill or dying patients have comfort and quality in their remaining days. CoxHealth at Home considers home care a calling, and that providing end-of-life care as both an honor and privilege for those who serve as hospice aides.

Job Perks & Benefits:
Tuition reimbursement up to $1,200 per year

Health/Dental/Vision

Retirement with employer match

On-site daycare with extended hours, holidays and weekends

On-site fitness facilities

Pharmacy delivery to your department

On-site Employee Health services

1906 Employee Store

20% tuition discount on most classes at Cox College

Cafeteria discount

Job Summary

Provides in home personal care services and other designated health-related services according to written and/or verbal directions prepared by registered professional personnel.

Job Requirements

Education

Completion of Home Health Aide competency test to be administered by CoxHealth at Home staff before Hire.

Completion of Home Health Aide basic skills test to be administered by CoxHealth at Home staff within 90 days of hire.

Experience

Six months of paid experience as an agency caregiver.

Skills

Ability to follow directions and perform duties with minimum supervision.

Exhibit sympathetic attitude toward the care of the sick.

Ability to provide reliable transportation as required by nature of position.

Licensure/Certification/Registration

BLS must be obtained within 90 days

Job Title: Certified Home Health Aide - Hospice - $1,500 sign-on bonus! Virtual Hiring Event
Job Description:
$1,500 Sign-On Bonus!

Providence is calling a Certified Home Health Aide - Hospice (Full time/Day Shift) to Providence TrinityCare Hospice in Torrance and Cerritos, CA.

We are seeking a Certified Home Health Aide - Hospice who will work under the supervision of a Registered Nurse and the Continuous Care Clinical Supervisor. The Continuous Care Hospice CHHA will perform various services for a patient as is necessary to meet the patient's personal needs and to promote comfort following the CHHA plan of care developed by the registered nurse in collaboration with the interdisciplinary team/group (IDG). The Continuous Care Hospice Certified Home Health Aide will be responsible for observing the patient, reporting these observations and documenting observations and care performed. The Continuous Care Hospice Certified Home Health Aide will be assigned to provide continuous nursing care to the patient during times of medical crisis, as directed in the Plan of Care, in a manner that promotes the quality, continuity and safety of a patient's care. The Continuous Care Certified Home Health Aide will be available for a minimum of 16 hours a week for continuous care assignments. May provide care to premature infants, infants, pediatrics, adolescents, young, middle and young adults.

Harmony Home Health is Medicare-Certified and State-Licensed.
The responsibilities of the Certified Home Health Aide include:
Providing personal care according to the care plan or as directed by RN, PT, OT: Baths, Back rubs, Oral hygiene, Shampoos, Changing bed linen, Assisting patients with dressing and undressing, Skin care to prevent breakdown, Assisting the patient with toileting activities, Keeping patient’s living area clean and orderly, as appropriate
Assisting in feeding the patient, if necessary.
Taking and recording oral, rectal and axillary temperatures, pulse, respiration and blood pressure when ordered (with appropriate completed/demonstrated skills competency).

Job Title: Private Duty Home Care Aide
Job Description:
Make Lives Better Including Your Own.
The happiness of those we serve is dependent on the happiness of our associates, so you’ll receive competitive compensation and a benefits package with additional perks designed to make you smile. The work you do will be challenging yet rewarding. But you’ll earn more than a paycheck; you can enjoy opportunities to grow your career, as well as ongoing programs catered to your health, financial, mental, and emotional needs. Most of all, we believe you can find purpose, meaning, and the chance to be a part of something bigger than yourself.
$1500 sign on bonus
Job Summary
Flexible schedule position that provides clients with assistance and companionship while recognizing clients’ individual needs and encourages independence.
Essential Functions
1. Non-medical hands on care; including dressing, bathing, grooming, personal care and assistance with transfers.
2. Provides one on one companionship to client.
3. May assist clients with medication as defined in medication procedure.
4. Performs general housekeeping following cleaning schedules for client laundry, bedrooms, dining area, living space, bathrooms, kitchen, etc.
5. Assists with pet care as needed.
6. Provides transportation to doctor's appointments and other errands.
7. Attends and participates in required training.
8. Maintains client confidentiality.
9. Communicates effectively with the clients, families, collaborative team. Notifying the manager of any changes in client condition / status.
10. Provides personal care to clients per their individualized plan of care.
This job description represents an overview of the responsibilities for the above referenced position. It is not intended to represent a comprehensive list of responsibilities. An associate should perform all duties as assigned by his/ her supervisor.

Job Title: Certified Home Health Aide (CHHA)
Job Description:
Harmony Home Health seeks a Per-Diem Certified Home Health Aide to join its dynamic team of healthcare professionals in the Contra Costa County, East Bay, Daly City, Half Moon Bay, Peninsula, San Francisco, San Mateo, Santa Clara, Pleasant Hill and Richmond areas. Harmony Home Health is Medicare-Certified and State-Licensed.
The responsibilities of the Certified Home Health Aide include:
Providing personal care according to the care plan or as directed by RN, PT, OT: Baths, Back rubs, Oral hygiene, Shampoos, Changing bed linen, Assisting patients with dressing and undressing, Skin care to prevent breakdown, Assisting the patient with toileting activities, Keeping patient’s living area clean and orderly, as appropriate
Assisting in feeding the patient, if necessary.
Taking and recording oral, rectal and axillary temperatures, pulse, respiration and blood pressure when ordered (with appropriate completed/demonstrated skills competency).
